members.member: Observed cluster padding, don't know where is comes from. The "ranksep" and "nodesep" default values at 50...?

member.name: T:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphConfig
member.summary: Represents the configuration used by Dagre

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphLayoutOptions.Direction
member.summary: Direction for rank nodes. Can be TB, BT, LR, or RL, where T = top, B = bottom, L = left, and R = right. The static class can be used: DagreGraphDirection.TopToBottom, DagreGraphDirection.BottomToTop, DagreGraphDirection.LeftToRight, DagreGraphDirection.RightToLeft Default: TB

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphLayoutOptions.Alignment
member.summary: Alignment for rank nodes. Can be UL, UR, DL, or DR, where U = up, D = down, L = left, and R = right. The static class can be used: DagreGraphAlignment.UpLeft, DagreGraphAlignment.UpRight, DagreGraphAlignment.DownLeft, DagreGraphAlignment.DownRight Default: undefined

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphLayoutOptions.NodeSeparation
member.summary: Number of pixels that separate nodes horizontally in the layout. Default: 50

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphLayoutOptions.EdgeSeparation
member.summary: Number of pixels that separate edges horizontally in the layout. Default: 10

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphLayoutOptions.RankSeparation
member.summary: Number of pixels between each rank in the layout. Default: 50

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphLayoutOptions.MarginX
member.summary: Number of pixels to use as a margin around the left and right of the graph. Default: 0

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphLayoutOptions.MarginY
member.summary: Number of pixels to use as a margin around the top and bottom of the graph. Default: 0

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphLayoutOptions.Acyclicer
member.summary: If set to greedy, uses a greedy heuristic for finding a feedback arc set for a graph. A feedback arc set is a set of edges that can be removed to make a graph acyclic. Default: undefined

member.summary: Provides data structures for undirected and directed multi-graphs

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.ChildrenAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Gets list of direct children of node v. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: children nodes names list.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.EdgeAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the label for the specified edge. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: value associated with specified edge.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.EdgeAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.GraphLibEdge)
member.summary: Gets the label for the specified edge. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: value associated with specified edge.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.EdgeCountAsync
member.summary: Gets the number of edges in the graph. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: edges count.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.EdgesAsync
member.summary: Gets edges of the graph. In case of compound graph subgraphs are not considered. Complexity: O(|E|).
member.returns: graph edges list.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.FilterNodesAsync(System.Func{System.String,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Creates new graph with nodes filtered via filter. Edges incident to rejected node are also removed. In case of compound graph, if parent is rejected by filter, than all its children are rejected too. Average-case complexity: O(|E|+|V|).
member.returns: new graph made from current and nodes filtered.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.GraphAsync
member.summary: Gets the graph metadata.
member.returns: currently assigned label for the graph or undefined if no label assigned.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.HasEdgeAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Detects whether the graph contains specified edge or not. No subgraphs are considered. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: whether the graph contains the specified edge or not.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.HasEdgeAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.GraphLibEdge)
member.summary: Detects whether the graph contains specified edge or not. No subgraphs are considered. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: whether the graph contains the specified edge or not.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.HasNodeAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Detects whether graph has a node with specified name or not.
member.returns: true if graph has node with specified name, false - otherwise.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.InEdgesAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return all edges that point to the node v. Optionally filters those edges down to just those coming from node u. Behavior is undefined for undirected graphs - use nodeEdges instead. Complexity: O(|E|).
member.returns: edges descriptors list if v is in the graph, or undefined otherwise.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.IsCompoundAsync
member.summary: Whether graph was created with 'compound' flag set to true or not.
member.returns: whether a node of the graph can have subnodes.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.IsDirectedAsync
member.summary: Whether graph was created with 'directed' flag set to true or not.
member.returns: whether the graph edges have an orientation.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.IsMultigraphAsync
member.summary: Whether graph was created with 'multigraph' flag set to true or not.
member.returns: whether the pair of nodes of the graph can have multiple edges.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.InstanceAsync
member.summary: Gets the underlying instance

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.NeighborsAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Return all nodes that are predecessors or successors of the specified node or undefined if node v is not in the graph. Complexity: O(|V|).
member.returns: node identifiers list or undefined if v is not in the graph.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.NodeAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the label of node with specified name. Complexity: O(|V|).
member.returns: label value of the node.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.NodeCountAsync
member.summary: Gets the number of nodes in the graph. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: nodes count.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.NodeEdgesAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns all edges to or from node v regardless of direction. Optionally filters those edges down to just those between nodes v and w regardless of direction. Complexity: O(|E|).
member.returns: edges descriptors list if v is in the graph, or undefined otherwise.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.NodesAsync
member.summary: Gets all nodes of the graph. Note, the in case of compound graph subnodes are not included in list. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: list of graph nodes.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.OutEdgesAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return all edges that are pointed at by node v. Optionally filters those edges down to just those point to w. Behavior is undefined for undirected graphs - use nodeEdges instead. Complexity: O(|E|).
member.returns: edges descriptors list if v is in the graph, or undefined otherwise.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.ParentAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Gets parent node for node v. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: parent node name or void if v has no parent.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.PredecessorsAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Return all nodes that are predecessors of the specified node or undefined if node v is not in the graph. Behavior is undefined for undirected graphs - use neighbors instead. Complexity: O(|V|).
member.returns: node identifiers list or undefined if v is not in the graph.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.RemoveEdgeAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.GraphLibEdge)
member.summary: Removes the specified edge from the graph. No subgraphs are considered. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.RemoveEdgeAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Removes the specified edge from the graph. No subgraphs are considered. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.RemoveNodeAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Remove the node with the name from the graph or do nothing if the node is not in the graph. If the node was removed this function also removes any incident edges. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetDefaultEdgeLabelAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the default edge label. This label will be assigned as default label in case if no label was specified while setting an edge. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetDefaultEdgeLabelAsync(System.Func{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the default edge label factory function. This function will be invoked each time when setting an edge with no label specified and returned value will be used as a label for edge. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetDefaultNodeLabelAsync(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the default node label. This label will be assigned as default label in case if no label was specified while setting a node. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetDefaultNodeLabelAsync(System.Func{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets the default node label factory function. This function will be invoked each time when setting a node with no label specified and returned value will be used as a label for node. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetEdgeAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates or updates the label for the edge (v, w) with the optionally supplied name. If label is supplied it is set as the value for the edge. If label is not supplied and the edge was created by this call then the default edge label will be assigned. The name parameter is only useful with multigraphs. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetEdgeAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.GraphLibEdge,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates or updates the label for the specified edge. If label is supplied it is set as the value for the edge. If label is not supplied and the edge was created by this call then the default edge label will be assigned. The name parameter is only useful with multigraphs. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetGraphAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IDagreGraphConfig)
member.summary: Sets the metadata of the graph.
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetNodeAsync(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates or updates the value for the node v in the graph. If label is supplied it is set as the value for the node. If label is not supplied and the node was created by this call then the default node label will be assigned. Complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetNodesAsync(System.String[],System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes setNode method for each node in names list. Complexity: O(|names|).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetParentAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets node p as a parent for node v if it is defined, or removes the parent for v if p is undefined. Method throws an exception in case of invoking it in context of noncompound graph. Average-case complexity: O(1).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SetPathAsync(System.String[],System.Object)
member.summary: Establish an edges path over the nodes in nodes list. If some edge is already exists, it will update its label, otherwise it will create an edge between pair of nodes with label provided or default label if no label provided. Complexity: O(|nodes|).
member.returns: the graph, allowing this to be chained with other functions.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SinksAsync
member.summary: Gets list of nodes without out-edges. Complexity: O(|V|).
member.returns: the graph source nodes.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SourcesAsync
member.summary: Gets list of nodes without in-edges. Complexity: O(|V|).
member.returns: the graph source nodes.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib.SuccessorsAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Return all nodes that are successors of the specified node or undefined if node v is not in the graph. Behavior is undefined for undirected graphs - use neighbors instead. Complexity: O(|V|).
member.returns: node identifiers list or undefined if v is not in the graph.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.ComponentsAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib)
member.summary: Finds all connected components in a graph and returns an array of these components. Each component is itself an array that contains the ids of nodes in the component. This function takes O(|V|) time.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.DijkstraAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib,System.String,System.Func{Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibEdge,System.Double},System.Func{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: This function is an implementation of Dijkstra's algorithm which finds the shortest path from source to all other nodes in g. This function returns a map of v -> { distance, predecessor }. The distance property holds the sum of the weights from source to v along the shortest path or Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY if there is no path from source. The predecessor property can be used to walk the individual elements of the path from source to v in reverse order. It takes an optional weightFn(e) which returns the weight of the edge e.If no weightFn is supplied then each edge is assumed to have a weight of 1. This function throws an Error if any of the traversed edges have a negative edge weight. It takes an optional edgeFn(v) which returns the ids of all edges incident to the node v for the purposes of shortest path traversal. By default this function uses the g.outEdges. It takes O((|E| + |V|) * log |V|) time.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.DijkstraAllAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib,System.String,System.Func{Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibEdge,System.Double},System.Func{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: This function finds the shortest path from each node to every other reachable node in the graph. It is similar to alg.dijkstra, but instead of returning a single-source array, it returns a mapping of of source -> alg.dijksta(g, source, weightFn, edgeFn). This function takes an optional weightFn(e) which returns the weight of the edge e.If no weightFn is supplied then each edge is assumed to have a weight of 1. This function throws an Error if any of the traversed edges have a negative edge weight. This function takes an optional edgeFn(u) which returns the ids of all edges incident to the node u for the purposes of shortest path traversal. By default this function uses g.outEdges. This function takes O(|V| * (|E| + |V|) * log |V|) time.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.FindCyclesAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib)
member.summary: Given a Graph, g, this function returns all nodes that are part of a cycle.As there may be more than one cycle in a graph this function return an array of these cycles, where each cycle is itself represented by an array of ids for each node involved in that cycle. alg.isAcyclic is more efficient if you only need to determine whether a graph has a cycle or not.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.FloydWarchallAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib,System.String,System.Func{Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibEdge,System.Double},System.Func{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: This function is an implementation of the Floyd-Warshall algorithm, which finds the shortest path from each node to every other reachable node in the graph. It is similar to alg.dijkstraAll, but it handles negative edge weights and is more efficient for some types of graphs. This function returns a map of source -> { target -> { distance, predecessor }. The distance property holds the sum of the weights from source to target along the shortest path of Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY if there is no path from source. The predecessor property can be used to walk the individual elements of the path from source to target in reverse order. This function takes an optional weightFn(e) which returns the weight of the edge e.If no weightFunc is supplied then each edge is assumed to have a weight of 1. This function takes an optional edgeFn(v) which returns the ids of all edges incident to the node v for the purposes of shortest path traversal. By default this function uses the outEdges function on the supplied graph. This algorithm takes O(|V|^3) time.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.IsAcyclicAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib)
member.summary: Given a Graph, g, this function returns true if the graph has no cycles and returns false if it does.This algorithm returns as soon as it detects the first cycle.You can use alg.findCycles to get the actual list of cycles in the graph.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.PostorderAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib,System.String)
member.summary: This function performs a postorder traversal of the graph g starting at the nodes vs. For each node visited, v, the function callback(v) is called.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.PreorderAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib,System.String)
member.summary: This function performs a preorder traversal of the graph g starting at the nodes vs. For each node visited, v, the function callback(v) is called.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.PrimAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib,System.Func{Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibEdge,System.Double})
member.summary: Prim's algorithm takes a connected undirected graph and generates a minimum spanning tree. This function returns the minimum spanning tree as an undirected graph. This algorithm is derived from the description in "Introduction to Algorithms", Third Edition, Cormen, et al., Pg 634. This function takes a weightFn(e) which returns the weight of the edge e.It throws an Error if the graph is not connected. This function takes O(|E| log |V|) time.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.TarjamAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib)
member.summary: This function is an implementation of Tarjan's algorithm which finds all strongly connected components in the directed graph g. Each strongly connected component is composed of nodes that can reach all other nodes in the component via directed edges. A strongly connected component can consist of a single node if that node cannot both reach and be reached by any other specific node in the graph. Components of more than one node are guaranteed to have at least one cycle. This function returns an array of components.Each component is itself an array that contains the ids of all nodes in the component.

member.name: M:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibAlg.TopsortAsync(Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLib)
member.summary: An implementation of topological sorting. Given a Graph g this function returns an array of nodes such that for each edge u -> v, u appears before v in the array.If the graph has a cycle it is impossible to generate such a list and CycleException is thrown. Takes O(|V| + |E|) time.

member.name: T:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibEdge
member.summary: Represents a edge

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibEdge.Name
member.summary: The name that uniquely identifies a multi-edge.

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibEdge.V
member.summary: The id of one node

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibEdge.W

member.name: T:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibOptions
member.summary: Represents the options used to construct a new

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibOptions.Compound
member.summary: Set to true to allow a graph to have compound nodes - nodes which can be the parent of other nodes. Default: false.

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibOptions.Directed
member.summary: Set to true to get a directed graph and false to get an undirected graph. An undirected graph does not treat the order of nodes in an edge as significant. In other words, g.edge("a", "b") === g.edge("b", "a") for an undirected graph. Default: true.

member.name: P:Neuroglia.Blazor.Dagre.Models.IGraphLibOptions.Multigraph
member.summary: Set to true to allow a graph to have multiple edges between the same pair of nodes. Default: false.
